vocabInfos.lsjDefs:
Σκύθ-ης, ου, ὁ:
vocative Σκύθᾰ [Refs 8th c.BC+], of a desert, [Refs 5th c.BC+]: metaphorically, rude, rough person, ἐν λόγοις Σ. [Refs 4th c.BC+]
__2 adjective [Refs 4th c.BC+]; σίδηρος [Refs 4th c.BC+]
__II at Athens, one of the city police, which was mainly composed of Scythian slaves, [Refs 5th c.BC+]
__II.2 ={ἱπποτοξότης}, [Refs 2nd c.AD+]
vocabInfos.mediumDef:
People living in Scythia, only mentioned at Col.3.11
§ A Scythian, a native of Scythia, the modern Mongolia and Tartary, Col. 3:11*
vocabInfos._es_Definition: escita (visto por el mundo romano como un ejemplo absoluto de paganismo COL.3:11)
vocabInfos._zh_tw_Definition:
西古提人 这个陽性專有名詞在原文的意思是 "粗魯的或不雅的"
居住在黑海, 是野蠻粗魯的象徵 (西 3:11)
vocabInfos._zh_Definition:
西古提人 这个阳性专有名词在原文的意思是 "粗鲁的或不雅的"
居住在黑海, 是野蛮粗鲁的象征 (西 3:11)
